thread.title: 'Why can't I get my chequebooks?'

title: 'Why can't I get my chequebooks?'
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Sun, Aug 30, 2015, 07:54 BST - UK Markets closed 'Why can't I get my chequebooks?' By Jessica Gorst-Williams | Telegraph – 41 minutes ago +0.19 
Our consumer experts steps in to help a reader with a recurring problem 
In April 2012 you wrote about the saga of my not getting a chequebook from Halifax. Unbelievably, we are here again. 
I telephoned Halifax to order a new chequebook and was assured it would be sent out in three to four weeks because I live in Germany. 
I am still waiting. BH, Germany 
I first covered the saga of your elusive chequebooks in 2008. Then again in June 2011 and in April 2012. 
Following a lot of discussion between myself, Royal Mail (LSE: RMG.L - news ) and Halifax the processes were changed. 
The bank said it had arranged that all your future chequebooks would be sent by the branch itself by first‑class post. 
• 'Halifax won’t change mortgage document' 
A specific member of the customer services team would monitor your account before the next chequebook was due. 
You used your cheques sparingly, but eventually they ran out. 
Apparently, a human error has meant that the account has been put “in default”. Now (NYSE: DNOW - news ) you have received not one new chequebook but two. 
• If you want to contact Jessica, click here
